intro: Adinandra obscurinervia, commonly known as the dark-veined adinandra, is a flowering plant species native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are usually elliptical with prominent, dark-colored veins, contributing to its common name. Adinandra obscurinervia is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
